conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C and needs to be traced through the diagram to predict which container (D, E, F, or G) it will flow into.
Stream A starts from the top left and flows downward.
Stream A encounters a cyan-colored baffle and is directed to the right.
Stream A continues to the right, bypassing other baffles until it reaches the bottom.

premise: Stream A flows downward, is redirected by the cyan baffle to the right, bypasses other baffles, and reaches the bottom.
conclusion: Stream A flows into container D.
Stream B starts from the middle top and flows downward.
Stream B encounters a green baffle and is redirected to the right.
Stream B follows the green baffle and flows downward.

premise: Stream B flows downward, is redirected by the green baffle to the right, and flows downward along the green baffle.
conclusion: Stream B flows into container F.
Stream C starts from the top right and flows downward.
Stream C encounters a pink-colored baffle and is redirected to the left.
Stream C continues to the left, bypassing other baffles until it reaches the bottom.

premise: Stream C flows downward, is redirected by the pink baffle to the left, bypasses other baffles, and reaches the bottom.
conclusion: Stream C flows into container E.

premise: Stream B and C merge after flowing along their respective baffles.
conclusion: The mixture of stream B and C separates into container F and G equally.

premise: Stream A flows into container D, and the mixture of stream B and C separates into container F and G equally.
conclusion: No liquid ends in container E.
